intro: Microrrhinum pterosporum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, spoon-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow composite flowers that develop into elongated, thin seed pods. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and grasslands. It has a taproot system and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Microrrhinum pterosporum is also noted for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
